author: abdel.stark
content: <@!301186049323958275>  Do we want a transition period for 2718 where we accept both legacy and typed transactions ? Like we have in 1559

author: abdel.stark
content: It is a breaking change for wallet and client implementers so maybe it would help to have a smooth transition

author: lightclient
content: I believe the idea is that nodes can convert legacy txs to type 0 txs, where type 0 txs have the same hashing procedure as the legacy ones

author: abdel.stark
content: So we don't include the transaction type in the signature if type == 0 ?

author: abdel.stark
content: Ok that makes sense. Thank you

author: abdel.stark
content: It seems 2718 would be super helpful if we don't want to bundle EIP 1559 and the escalator

author: abdel.stark
content: We could have type 1 = EIP 1559 alone, type 2 = Escalator alone, type 3 = EIP 1559 + escalator

author: abdel.stark
content: Don't know if it brings too much complexity though

author: abdel.stark
content: Still better than guessing the type with different RLP decoding IMO
